snippet: After it is renovated, the 369th Regiment Armory will have a “museum grade” exhibition of artifacts related to the Harlem Hellfighters, a black unit that fought in World War I.
abstract: Renovated 369th Regiment Armory in Harlem will have a 'museum grade' exhibition of artifacts collected by Maj Gen Nathaniel James related to the black unit Harlem Hellfighters that fought in World War I; James, who joined the New York Army Guard at 17, has dedicated his life to raising the profile of the largely overlooked unit.
lead_paragraph: After it is renovated, the 369th Regiment Armory will have a “museum grade” exhibition of artifacts related to the Harlem Hellfighters, a black unit that fought in World War I.

headline.main: A Life Dedicated to Raising the Profile of a Black Army Unit Overlooked by History
headline.print_headline: A Life Dedicated to Raising the Profile of a Black Army Unit Overlooked by History

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
